website_summaries.verdict: While it's a heavy-duty reel, it has its share of both quality features and some potentially frustrating design flaws.
pros: A versatile, steel hose reel that can be mounted or placed on the floor – no-slip rubber bottom "boots" keep it in place at floor level
Built to last – constructed of 13-gauge steel
cons: Doesn't come with a hose – just 5 ft. of leader hose
You also have to purchase hardware for installation
Some reports of rust developing with outdoor use
Hose connection is in an awkward location

website_summaries.verdict: A budget-friendly model considering its steel craftsmanship that holds up better than plastic reels. Its few reported issues don't cancel out the unbeatable deal.
pros: Affordable yet has a lot to offer
Low-profile yet solidly constructed 13-gauge steel unit capable of lawn, floor, or wall mounting
Comes with five feet of leader hose with sturdy fittings
Handles up to 200 feet of hose
cons: Some owners have reported chipping of the painted coating, resulting in rust
It's not easy to dismount for off-season storage

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY POOR PAINT JOB
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these reels. 4 months after installation they are beginning to rust and it is only a meter of time before they become a mess. Especially disconcerting especially since this product is involved with water routinely. Wrote to the company and they have indicated that they don't stand behind the product regards rusting. There are numerous quality finishing techniques available today - there is no excuse for poor finishes on any product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Scattoloni

customer_reviews.title: Super Hose Reel
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent hose reel. The only issue is the hose attachment point. RICK had a supper hack that took care of the problem and I incorporated it on all five of mine. I've been a plumber for going on 40 years and it surprised me how easy the fix is. I used 2 each 1/2" galv 90 ells and 1 each galv 1/2'"x 1 1/2" nipple and a 1/2" x 2 1/2" nipple. I included a before and after pic.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Kruse

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect - Forget all the cute, artsy reels - This Liberty is the one you need.
customer_reviews.text: Rugged, well-engineered, simple to mount, simple to use and holds over 100' of hose. Did I mention it's made of steel!! Comes with Brass connectors which don't seize up, corrode and are hefty enough for light wrench tightening. Even comes with pliable rubber seals instead of hard plastic. The rolling action of the reel is smooth and well-mannered. The Reel Lever is hard-plastic over steel and rolls smooth in your hand as you turn it. And last but not least - there is no breakable hose placement device so that's one less item to worry about. Forget all the cute, artsy reels - This Liberty is the one you need.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design.........
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Hose attachment to spindle is bogus. Directions are vague at best. Needs zip ties or similar to attach hose to avoid kinking. I opted for a street 90 which didn't help much. I hope they can come up with a better design. Dash any hope of keeping stationary using what is provided. I kept it in an occasional use reel. Daily use no. Instructions say not to leave the reel unsupervised, might be planning on a failure?
customer_reviews.author: Gil Ingraham

customer_reviews.title: HANDLE BANGS/ WONT TURN— SO ANNOYING
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of this thing but am pretty annoyed And am too lazy to return it. The handle bangs into the housing making it impossible to unwind and wind easily. Im going to try to bang it with a mallet and see if I can bend the handle. Not really acceptable for 80 bucks. So update, I am not too lazy to return it bc I did so today. Not messing with trying to fix it by bending the handle. A huge pain to take the hose off etc etc. This was a VERY frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: PeeKay

customer_reviews.title: Hose connection design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Brass fittings nice, but MAJOR design flaw on the model I purchased — the hose to reel connector is outside the reel, so you have to thread the hose through an opening in the side of the reel, which means that the hose is always kinked. [sigh] I note that on the Liberty Gardens website, this unit appears to have been redesigned with the reel to hose connection on the inside. Info & photos on Amazon do not reflect this, so who knows what you’ll get. Unfortunately, I am stuck with having to attempt to retrofit my RUSTING one-year-old caddy. [a number of other reviewers have shown how to do this, but it’s still a pain & additional expense]
customer_reviews.author: kv450

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bracket that holds the reel spreads out and hits the handle so that you have to use one-hand to push the bracket back and the other hand to wind the hose. Also had to buy fittings so that the hose attachment didn't kink the hose. Overall: JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS C LIPINSKI

customer_reviews.title: I own 4 reels.
customer_reviews.text: The 3 issues. (1) The feed line wants to wind up & kink when your winding up the hose reel. I changed the feed hose with a braided line that is sold as a washing machine supply line. (2) the hose wants to kink up where it connects at the inner winding row. Look close at my photo and I have a zip tie holding the hose to round ring of the reel. This helps to keep the hose from kinking up. (3) The handle hits the reel bracket. See the scraping of the paint. I have plans on buying 3 more next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ruback

customer_reviews.title: Third purchase- first two are great
customer_reviews.text: The first two reels are great and I live by the sea shore with a lot of salty air. If I see a spot of rust I apply ospho and paint the spot (standard procedure here). My newest purchase has holes on each side of each reel so after a rain, it spewed black water when I pulled hose from the reel. I read reviews and learned it is a common complaint. I filled the holes with thickened G Flex epoxy and hope the problem is permanently resolved. These are the best hose reels I have ever purchased, but do not understand why the manufacturer would ruin them with the seemingly unnessary holes.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Crumley

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. Typical Chinese quality.
customer_reviews.text: This hose reel is a typical Chinese-made POS. The handle bangs on the frame. My handle immediately stripped out on the spindle. I figured instead instead of sending it back, I’d make it work, so I drilled two holes in the handle and screwed it directly to the spindle. The handle still contacts the frame when I crank it, but I deal with it. I’m really surprised that it doesn’t leak (yet). I guess it kinda works as intended, with my fixes. Just be aware of what you are getting. If you’re not mechanically inclined, you might pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product! I replaced it with a much older unit that went bad and fell apart due to calcium build up. The first time I turned it on, it started leaking through threaded fixture. It didn't seam to have and thread seal. This unit looked, and was advertised as very sturdy, but it's not, it shakes from side to side when you crank to real in hose, and handle was hitting the frame. I'm going to weld a piece of metal to make it sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, leaked where pipe connects to reel
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, I could tell this was not well made. Pipe tape poorly installed, washers smashed unevenly, paint chipping around the axle. After installing the handle, the bolt protruded out too far, hitting the frame. But, I decided to install anyways. After mounting to the stone on the front of my house, I hooked up the hoses, turned on the water (I had a nozzle on the end of the hose, so the hose was pressurized). Once the hose was pressurized, water was leaking out around the smashed washer. I do not recommend this hose reel, I am returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: heffnejp

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: The metal is flimsy and will fall when you’re unreeling the hose. The handle is made of cheap plastic that broke off right away and the metal started rusting almost immediately. I bought this one because I thought it would be the most durable but the plastic box style turned out to be more stable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: NN

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy product - well made. It easily holds my NeverKink 3/4-in x 100-ft Contractor-Duty garden hose. It comes with four skinny holding rods to hold the reel to the ground, but I wish I could buy some REAL holding rods. But until I find some, the rods it come with are fine, as long as you don't yank hard unreeling the hose, or pull the hose off the reel at an angle. I sure wish I had bought this initially instead of the several crappy cheap plastic things they sell at Lowes and Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Leahey

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel but rough handling caused damage
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Liberty hose reel I've purchased; it's a good and sturdy reel. Unfortunately this one was roughly handled. The box was clearly dragged long enough and fast enough to wear through the cardboard and cause bare metal flat spots on the reel --even a scorch mark on one side. The handle also seems to be bent out. I'll need to repaint but it's useable I think. I'd like to get a partial refund as I don't think I am getting my $80 worth from the product. Amazon offers only straight returns, no discounts. so I am posting here so maybe the company can up their packaging game to prevent more damage incidents.
customer_reviews.author: Spingus

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to get my hose reel because I have had to store my hose on the ground for so long. I had gotten other lower costing reels in the past and they would only last 1 or 2 years. This one looks like it will last us for many years to come. It's easy to assemble because there is only a couple of things to install on it, everything else comes preassembled. It's beautiful as well. I think you will love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Gibb

customer_reviews.title: Solid reel, great for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted something durable to hold a long garden hose. The previous hose reels I have purchased have broken along the reel or the handle. I mounted this to a bench outside and this has proven itself to be high-quality. I used this daily and it rolls up a 50 foot garden hose with no problems. It has withstood a hot summer and lots of wear and tear and still works as good as new. The only downfall is it has no place to hang the nozzle once the hose is all rolled up. Many hose reels don’t have this feature either, so don’t let that be a deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Find a better hose reel
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed in this hose reel. It was very easy to put together. It strays water everywhere. So it causes puddles. It's not strong enough to reel the hose up at all and the second time I used it the wheel fell off of the hose connection. Now everytime I use it that part falls apart. I always wanted a hose reel. I just didn't realize it was that much of a pain
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: Think hard before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: The handle hits the frame and will cause chipping of the paint which will cause rust later. Mine showed up and has a leak between the frame and the galvanized tee which is a place that I do not see an adjustment. Handle should have a off set bend to eliminate hitting the frame. Simple fix if they would do it. I will follow up review after I contact them
customer_reviews.author: bassman

customer_reviews.title: Received a used reel!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product one year ago. Arrived without a handle. I decided was not a big deal. Never hooked up to a hose until this month. The connections all have white plumber tape - and it leaks! Now that I had a chance to use this I believe I received a used one and got screwed !! What is the warranty on this product? It’s pretty expensive to fall apart in 30 days,
customer_reviews.author: Rita Marianna

customer_reviews.title: Leaks badly and not set up right
customer_reviews.text: I have this product and like its sturdiness. However they didn't design is well because it leaks badly where the axle is. Also, the placement connector of the garden hose on the real makes it difficult to get the hose placed where you can get a good start on winding it up. Do not buy this if you have a heavy duty hose. I do and had to spend another $20 on angled hose connectors to get the hose connection where it should be.
customer_reviews.author: JP Howard

customer_reviews.title: Reel is nice, but could benefit from minor design and material quality improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Nice reel. The plastic handle seems like it will fail prematurely. Time will tell. I added wooden feet and replumbed the hose connection to the reel with an extension and 90 degree elbow so the connection points in the direction for the hose to naturally wrap around the reel without kinking. The hose between the reel and the house has nice fittings but the actual hose itself is junk. Its collapsed in a couple places. I'm going to fabricate a replacement hose from better hose stock. I have 200' of commercial grade hose on my reel.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Good reel but not for 200 feet.
customer_reviews.text: I know it says wall and floor mount, but I was trying to use it as a free standing hose reel - and it's not that great for that. Definitely don't buy this if you're looking for a free standing reel. Also, the description states 200 feet. and it definitely DOES NOT hold 200 feet of hose. 150 max for a good reel. at about 175, it starts to get in its own way and unravels or pops out of the spindle so I've used this for my shorter hose and not the 200 footer. Sad because the 200 footer is what needs a reel.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Saggio

customer_reviews.title: A little top heavy
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, but if used flat, winding a hose will topple it easily. Larger holes in the base would have allowed larger stakes to secure it, but the thin metal stakes for the tiny holes they provide are pretty useless. These are best mounted on a wall UNLESS you go with a collapsible flat lightweight hose design like the Zero G, which works fine on this unit. That was my solution.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Poor experience and then it broke
customer_reviews.text: From the start, I had issues with kinking hose and the wheel was wobbly when trying to roll up the hose. The arm was bent a little inwards when I received it, and got worse. Today when I went to roll up the hose, I found the left side had broken and was hanging free (the "axle" portion that connects to the water line). I'm hoping I can fix it, but definitely won't be purchasing this one again.
customer_reviews.author: David Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Claimed hose length capicity of 200ft questionable
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably sturdy product. I like that it has both rubber feet and stake option so it can be positioned on a hard surface (without drilling holes) or staked into the ground. The picture shows my hose reel with a Giraffe Tools 100ft light hybrid (heavy duty/lightweight) hose attached. From the pictures one can see this reel would be hard pressed to hold 200 ft even with my 100ft hose the reel is not 100% stable on a concrete surface using the just the rubber feet so the extra 100ft of hose would most likely cause it to tip over if not bolded or staked.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Williams

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but worth the extra $$$
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sold on the price point, it seemed a little steep. After using the reel multiple times and having had checked out other options this was definitely the best buy. Most of the other products available are made out of some type of plastic this reels is entirely made out of metal with the exception of the crank cover (not that big of a deal). I have had several people come over and compliment on the sturdiness and how easy to feel the hose back in once fully extended. Still think it was a little pricey but it was worth it!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Quality Water swivel fitting
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably solid hose reel with a high quality brass swivel fitting. This may require some new pipe tape or silicone on threads but the fitting is good. Once tuned up this thing is leak free when the water is off at your sprayer or hose end. I have bought 3 because think value quotient is great. Slight downgrade for tuning effort.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C

customer_reviews.title: Broken welds on spool
customer_reviews.text: When I unpacked this reeler, the flange that is welded to the spool that hooks up to the water supply was broken off due to poor welding. I have 6 of these and this is the first time I have had a problem. I have requested a new functional spool from the manufacturer. We'll see if they come through.
customer_reviews.author: J D Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: After about 2 years--rusty junk
customer_reviews.text: Looks good in the pictures, but using it is not so good. My wife, the garden person, hates it. We'll be getting a plastic one. like the one we've had for about 15 years. It finally broke, but worked better than this "powder coated" metal one, which started internal rusting from day one.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Boliou

customer_reviews.title: Leaking connections
customer_reviews.text: We would have given it 5 stars however it was certainly not plug and play. When we first set it up and connected it to the water supply every fitting leaked. My boyfriend had to take them apart and redo the Teflon tape on each one. Now that it no longer leaks, It does seem like it’s going to be quite sturdy and hopefully will last much longer than the plastic one we replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Muterspaugh

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: We attempted to install TWO of these hose reels and the washers connecting the leader hose to the unit were MISSING!!!!!!!! It is leaking badly without the washers. Unless Liberty sends us 4 of these washers immediately, we are going to return the units!
customer_reviews.author: Nana Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Needs more fittings
customer_reviews.text: In order to hook the hose to the reel INSIDE of the reel, one needs to spend about $75 in brass fittings, making it fairly pricy. Works fine, now, but I do have to check the hose fittings to make sure they're tight. I'm just about to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: GreatKahuna

customer_reviews.title: These use to be a great product
customer_reviews.text: I own a professional dog kennel. We use these in our facility. They are wall mounted in various locations where we need a hose. I usually get 3 to 4 years of daily use out of them We always keep a spare hose reel on hand just in case. I ordered this in Sept as a spare and it's been sitting in the unopened box on a shelf until 1/1/20 when I replaced an old one. Right out of the box within 24 hours leaking a steady drip. Unfortunately it's too late to try to return it due to their return policy even though it's brand new.
customer_reviews.author: South Paw

customer_reviews.title: Well made hose reel
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and works as it is supposed to. No leaks. The only problem I've encountered - I've got it laying horizontal (as in the photo) and I've attached these small rubber mounts at the 4 corners; however, it is not well stabilized when I reel in the hose. I find that I need to step on the base as I reel in the hose. I suppose that this reel would work better if mounted on the wall in a vertical position.
customer_reviews.author: michiko

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd one.  the first one lasted about 15 years.
customer_reviews.text: It is well made and long lasting. The fittings wore out on the last one (after about 15 years), and when I ordered replacement parts, they fit my reel, but the old fittings broke when I tried to remove them (Brass). This reel is identical to my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Ray P

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice hose reel. I am very happy with the quality. I wanted a heavy hose reel that would not topple when I was reeling in my hose (about 125ft). I decided to put it in the ground as it came with some lawn pins. They were very flimsy and the reel would pull out of the ground when reeling, but with some tent nails I bought for $6 at my local hardware store, it stays in the ground and does not pull up when reeling. If it were mounted to the side of the house it would not be a problem at all. Nice product. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Glavin

customer_reviews.title: If you have anything over 80 feet 5/8”; this reel will NOT handle it.
customer_reviews.text: This reel did not even hold 150 ft of 5/8 hose...wish I had known before mounting. Really flimsy unit. My worst Amazon purchase ever... I have mounted but as you can see in pics the reel if full!!!! Got to go but smaller hose. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Rodman107

customer_reviews.title: I would by from the seller again, but not the manufacturer of the product.
customer_reviews.text: Shopping with the seller was excellent. Received my item very promptly. The problem was the person who put it together made it seem like they didn't care. Had to take all apart get rid of a whole role of Teflon tape and rubber orings that wasn't needed and reassemble the right way.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and exactly what I needed- a sturdy and strong metal quality pipe reel/holder and this is the only one model that can be used on both floor or installed on wall. Moreover, way cheaper option than the other models in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: kiran

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old plastic hose reel. It's on the ground using the provided anchors into the dirt. The 100 feet of hose I have on it spools off easily and is easily wound back up. I've been using it for over a month, it hasn't moved and I've had no problems with it. If I had a secure place to mount it on a vertical surface I would have but it works just fine being anchored to the ground. Liberty Garden Products is based in North Carolina and their customer service is excellent and calls get answered by a human being, not a round and round voice menu.
customer_reviews.author: JR 44308

customer_reviews.title: Better than plastic but not the best of quality no ...
customer_reviews.text: Better than plastic but not the best of quality no slots where the holes are so you can’t easily remove it when winter gets here it is not powder coated like they claim every joint leak had to disassemble the whole thing and seal all the joints only time will prove if it’s better than the plastic ones I do like how much hose it will hold and how easy it is to wind it up
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, will keep, but leaks
customer_reviews.text: Had to install on the exterior of our brick house. I didn't have the masonry bits or else it would've been a quick install. Ended up taking a while also cause I kept buying the wrong piece, but luckily I'm close. Only qualm I have is that the connection that connects from the hose reel to the actual faucet leaks a little bit (not to the point where I can't use the actual hose but its annoying. I've tried plugging it with silicone gel, well see if it fixes it after 24 hours. However, the fiancee loves the look, and I'm buying a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Phan

customer_reviews.title: You had one job!
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this after waiting weeks for it to arrive (ordered on July 27th received August 14th), and of course it leaks. In addition to it leaking, the hose kinks when wound making it pretty unusable unless you unfurl the entire hose. This product, plane and simple is a miss.
customer_reviews.author: Honez

customer_reviews.title: Has issues
customer_reviews.text: Two issues with this hose reel: 1) The nut holding the handle on hits the brace on every revolution, effectively removing the paint after a few uses. The nut also constantly works itself loose, which is an irritation. 2) The water remaining inside the unit is apparently rusting it, because there is a small burst of rusty water coming out of the hose every time it is turned on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Woodall

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: An excellent and strong hose reel. I had the reel mounted on a concrete block wall by a handyman, as I could not do this myself (being 76 years old!) I'm pleased with the hose reel, and bought a second reel for another area.
customer_reviews.author: Theology Girl

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Hose Reel.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very solid. The reel and base are made of steel. The supply hose fittings are heavy brass. The fitting for your hose is galvanized steel. This reel is holding seventy five feet of heavy hose with no problems. The reel diameter is 17 inches. The reel inside opening is 9.75 inches wide The paint smooth and looks like it will hold up through our Michigan Winters. I am very happy with this product and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: WA8UOC

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit after reading all the reviews about the issues I was on the fence on whether to buy. Well I bought it and love it. If you take the suggestions to caulk the holes, lacquer the reel and add the pipe nipple extension to the inside reel it's perfect. Granted the company should address these issues but for 60.00 you can't go wrong when the cheap plastic hose reels aren't all that much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Costa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: This hose reel was purchased on Amazon exactly 18 months ago. The paint has flaked off in huge areas and the reel is rusty. It will be a surprise if it survives two years. This purchase expectation was that it would be lasting for several years.
customer_reviews.author: CapeCod

customer_reviews.title: Chinese quality POS. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Leaks right out of the box. Flimsy. The handle could be 4" longer for better leverage. Out of round. In all reality, it's a Chinese quality POS. Would not buy again. It does roll up a hose, but not sure how long.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Already Rusty and Keeps Breaking
customer_reviews.text: Product did not easily support my hose. It kept kinking. Now after about two months it is starting to rust and the handle keeps unscrewing by itself. Not worth the money. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mitchel

customer_reviews.title: Not versatile.
customer_reviews.text: this does not fit the description which was written about it the product is for small garden hose not for over hundred ans it was mentioned about its description,I will never recommend it as versatile product.
customer_reviews.author: Maiwand

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be well made
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace our plastic hose reel which broke after 7 years. We purchased the Liberty Garden reel hoping it would be our last. The unit arrived very well packed in double boxes and fully assembled except for the handle. Somewhere along the manufacturing/packaging process, both arms of the main bracket that the reel mounts onto was bent towards the left. I was able to partially bend it back so I could use the unit. It should work OK, but the QC is somewhat lacking.... otherwise seems like a well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paint flakes off quickly, and it rusts.
customer_reviews.text: It looks pretty good and works OK, and only leaks a little bit. But I've never been really happy with it, the paint started flaking off almost right away, leaving gaps of raw metal that quickly rusted. The handle likes to fall off too, and it has a bit of a rinky-dink feel to it overall.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lefferts

customer_reviews.title: This should be done at the factory but is easily done by a home owner
customer_reviews.text: Durable steel and quality brass fittings. I redirected the direction of the output fitting so the hose does not have to loop over the outside of the reel. I tried several different parts and ended up using a 2" nipple and a 90 degree elbo. This should be done at the factory but is easily done by a home owner. This is the best basic design of all the reels on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Menno Y.

customer_reviews.title: Really like the quality of this product
customer_reviews.text: Really like the quality of this product. It hasn't been through a season yet so I will see how the paint holds up. However from an ease of use perspective the hose just rolls on and off very easy without any strain compared to other plastic models out there. I've broken enough handles on the plastic hose reel carts that this metal one is what i was looking for. Great price and worth while.
customer_reviews.author: Fab

customer_reviews.title: Product fittings leaks
customer_reviews.text: Manufactured fittings are not tight and leak excessively. You will have to tighten the fittings yourself once you get the product. Easier to do before mounting and hook-up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Twice the deception
customer_reviews.text: This reel is a worthless. I bought this twice. I am a contractor and needed one for my van so gave two chances in hope tge second time would arrive in good shape, wasn't the case. First time I bought it, box arrived all broken and so was the reel. It is very poorly packed. Once you spin it all unscrews very easily and falls apart. The side valve and fitting does not stays in place.. Returned the first one, gave a second chance and same thing happened. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Annemarie Matos

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming.
customer_reviews.text: As an Engineer, my expectations are probably a little higher than the average consumer, but I was pretty disappointed with this hose reel on so many fronts. It’s poorly designed, poorly assembled, and just seems very cheap. I sent it back immediately upon opening and assembling the reel.
customer_reviews.author: John Siebs

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The handle was bent a little in shipment ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The handle was bent a little in shipment but use a pipe to straighten it out. Wiped it completely with bees wax to prevent any rust. Will update after it has spent a year outside. Using some old 5/8 inch hose on it now but will probably change to 1/2 inch hose next year, which
customer_reviews.author: North Central Texas

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The swivel for the leader hose turns with the hose reel binding itself. Instructions say "take the retaining clip off and spray some silicone in the swivel"! I should not have to spray anything except water out of my hose!
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: They are made for fastening to the exterior of your house
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to make holes in my siding so I sat it on top of two concrete blocks and fastened it down with bungee cords. The weight of the blocks keeps it from moving when you pull on the hose. The reel is sturdy and heavy; I now have two of them. It's pretty hard work rolling up a 100' hose, but that would be true with any reel.
customer_reviews.author: Bert L.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Bad design. Inlet side of hose wraps around wheel to start rolling up. It kinks and damages the hose from the get go. Wheel seems smooth. Just a design flaw which makes the unit nonfunctional
customer_reviews.author: David Traenkner

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I checked before mounting it
customer_reviews.text: There are a few major flaws with this, first being that the quality control is non-existent. The fittings were hand tight with TONS of Teflon tape, I am glad I checked before mounting it. Next was the poor design, the mounting bracket had no bushing's!!!!!. Just metal on metal, that will be garbage in no time. How difficult would it be to add a crappy plastic bushing, for $80 I expected something that wouldn't tear it self apart after a year of use. There are more terrible flaws this unit has, so if you want something that will work out of the box DON'T BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, all you really need without the fluff.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these for opposite sides of the house. After having two previous plastic hose reel units break and fall off the wall, we were attracted to the sturdy construction and hose capacity of this reel. It does not swivel, and you’ll have to guide the hose yourself as you wind it back onto the spool. Awww! Did you get your hands dirty? Worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Garman

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: Well made and Looks good in my garden. The tiny metal stakes provided to anchor the base to the ground are useless. You'll have to get some thicker tent stakes to really hold it down.
customer_reviews.author: Douged out

customer_reviews.title: Does Not hold 200 feet of 5/8" hose.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't hold 200ft of 5/8" hose. That's the whole reason why I bought it. Waste of money. If I had a thinner hose and not as much then it would be possibly just fine. Since the hose won't fit on it I haven't secured it to the ground so I don't know how good that works. At least my Dad can use this for his thinner and lighter hose.
customer_reviews.author: HLB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Looks and functions as described. I'm a renter so I didn't use the mounting hardware, but the rubber grips make it sturdy as a free-standing reel.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: The crank shaft breaks away from the reel
customer_reviews.text: It was the best hose reel I ever had until it broke. The crank handle shaft is very weakly attached to the reel and, with only 75 feet of rubber hose, It broke after 4 months, cranking it only three times with a fully extended hose. I'm going to weld it back on myself with reinforcement...why pay postage to hopefully get an equally weak returned item under warranty after who knows how long?
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: Showed up leaking with gaskets distorted
customer_reviews.text: Had to disassemble swivel to tighten up pipe threads on each side of the tee. They were not tightened, but rather put together loosely with some gaskets that are misshaped and leaking What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear - Poor in ever way...
customer_reviews.text: This this is absolute trash. Please do yourself a favor and buy any other hose reel available. I bought another from Home Depot for half the price that is 500x better. This one is heavy, but not sturdy. When reeling in hose it likes to fall into pieces. Super helpful. I am so upset that I missed my 30 day return window. This is the worst product I have purchased in years. I am not sure it could have been designed more poorly. Don’t pay the dumb tax like i did...
customer_reviews.author: Daryn P Edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Great reel but just fix the connection
customer_reviews.text: The reel is very sturdy and easy to mount. However the design of the hose connection has its flaws. The angle of the connection makes it difficult to connect the hose. I attached an elbow to correct the issue. This would be an easy fix for the company producing the product.
customer_reviews.author: JMK

customer_reviews.title: still leaking spent a lot of money on this I expected a better
customer_reviews.text: Short hose that came with leaked all over the place . I was unable to make it work had to get a new hose. still leaking spent a lot of money on this I expected a better product
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty - Well Built - But.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good sturdy, HD, product BUT....the hose inlet should be at a better angle. Directly to the hose via Reel not Around it.
customer_reviews.author: Danpb

customer_reviews.title: Arrived rusty
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box to find dirty ragged teflon tape hanging from joints (is this used?). The paint is chipped off of the handle, revealing rust. Yup rusty right out of the box. Returning for a refund. Anything brand new that needs to be babied or retrofitted before use is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control - No QA/QC
customer_reviews.text: Obviously the manufacturer has no QA/QC manager ! Materials are suitable and sturdy, the entire problem is the fit up and how it was welded. The fitting was welded to the threaded coupling to the face of the reel > 3° out of plumb. This caused the hose reel to wobble terribly when the reel is hand cranked. Also several spots where the powder coating contained holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Litton

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, easy hose solution.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these. They are so good. I use heavy rubber hoses and don’t like to handle a dirty hose. This is a perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie D.

customer_reviews.title: Good looking put poor results!
customer_reviews.text: I had to modify the inlet hose connection with brass elbows to keep it from kinking and blocking the water flow (cost $12).. If you have less than 100 ft. of hose, the reel will not turn anymore when the last 50 ft. of hose is being pulled as it binds against the reel sides. It is well made and looks good, but I would not recommend it . Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a few months ago and love it. I have had my share of plastic hose reels that seem to fall apart after a few months. This product is solid. I will never buy another plastic one. I saw the review where the owner said the hose connection was in the wrong place. The connection is fine. The picture clearly shows that the owner connected the hose incorrectly. In summary I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Retractable garden hose unit
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and will not collapse like plastic. I would suggest you rework bad design where the hose enters the unit. Bad kinks !!!!!!!!! Over all, love the unit.
customer_reviews.author: topgun

customer_reviews.title: Recieved damaged/defective.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sturdy heavy-duty steel construction, however the packaging left a great deal to be desired with carton beaten up and a hole poked through it. When removed, I found that the handle/arm appeared to be bent inward. Upon attaching the handle/arm , this was verified. Unable to fix this obviously. It would scrape against the side if I attempted to reel it. Had to return it. Hoping it was just a lemon or damaged in delivery process.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie Godwin

customer_reviews.title: Will rust
customer_reviews.text: First thing you should do is paint it with some thick rust proof paint, and make sure to use a syringe to put a lot of paint into the wheel weep holes and roll the paint around inside them.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Quality hose reel for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: A great hose reel. I like that it's metal, and sturdy. Winds easily and you can use this on the ground or mounted to a wall. The supplied rubber bumpers are difficult to install, and I had to lubricate them and use a hammer to pound them into place (actually light blows from a sledge). It was a good price and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I used this reel to make a portable DEF filling station. It is mounted to the top of a 50 gallon and makes using and putting away 50ft of thick hose a simple task.
customer_reviews.author: Boston8273

customer_reviews.title: Rusts within 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I liked this when I first bought it but within two years the paint was peeling off and it is rusting like crazy. I would not recommend this product - it is incredibly expensive for something that has failed so soon after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Need help from seller
customer_reviews.text: Leaking from the unit, what can I tighten to stop the small spilling leak from main casing? Seller, please advise. The website requested rating, at the moment, I can’t until someone contact me to answer the question
customer_reviews.author: JVines

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just has a few flaws that could be improved upon.
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to mount. The holes are between the reel and the frame not giving you any room to get a cordless screwdriver in to this tight area to tighten up the screws. Also the nut that holds the handle to the reel rubs up against the reel frame when your winding the water hose up, scraping the paint off of the frame of the reel. Had to bend the whole handle out away from the frame to keep it from rubbing.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Vachon

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, sturdy product. It fits my need. The one thing I would change is that I would have the hose hook up inside the reel, but it loops over the outside. Minor issue, and it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: Good, heavy
customer_reviews.text: Good, heavy, solid piece. However, tried to secure on ground using enclosed earth staples. Didn't work. Added 4 more, 12" staples, still didn't hold. Husband going to mount on house. Sure hope that works. For now, holding bottom piece down with our foot and it rolls in nice and easy. You do have to guide in with your other hand which I didn't realize. This will be a bit of a pain but if it last more than 2 years we'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Ann

customer_reviews.title: Kinda stupidly built
customer_reviews.text: hard to use stationary, needs to be mounted to something. hose hookup is less than desireable, kinks the hose, put a 90 on there but still, not very well designed, but it works for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and effert
customer_reviews.text: Had to modify the hose hook up so it doesn't pinch off the hose, but other than that, they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: Great hose reel
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 heavy farm hoses and made them manageable. rolls up 200 feet of hose in a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy but
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and sturdy which is what I was looking for to be able to hold a lot of hose. I like all the metal parts and the rotating handle. However, I've had it on the back of my house for only about 1 month and I'm already starting to see rust on the joints. I'm going to have to buy some tan paint and touch it up.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for 4 years now. Still works great with no issues and no rust (Southwest USA).
customer_reviews.author: SDK

customer_reviews.title: Turn handle only worked 1 time
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look of it & it was the perfect size for my use. I hooked it up & cranked the handle to wind the hose up. Then I extended the hose out & tried to rewind it. The crank turned, but the reel did not turn. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Staelgraeve

customer_reviews.title: I purchased one with wheels, and this one. ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one with wheels, and this one... Now I wish I would have gotten both with wheels. This does everything you want it to and is well built so if you can mount it on the wall or something, this will work for you., I have a huge yard so I move the hose and doesn't work as well in that application.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Well, it looked good, and the stainless counterpart which is three times as much is sturdy, but the spokes on the wheels of this one are so frail that one of them was broken when it arrived--the welds are minimal and in this case, lacking--a nice design, but I don't think that it would have delivered much service for very long as much as the manufacturer seems to have skimped on materials and labor. So after returning it, which was very easy with the UPS home pickup arranged by Amazon, I decided to simply roll up the hose myself.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Berman

customer_reviews.title: Shop around
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy enough however, the handle scrapes the side; not too happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: teachsci4evr

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very solid product, good weight and balance and smooth operation. The issue of hose kinking is easily solved with a flexible hose extender. My review is less about the product, though, than about the company. The reel leaked badly when I first installed it, and the company responded immediately to my inquiry and sent me a complete set of replacement o-rings, which solved the problem. To me the measure of good customer service is how -- and how quickly -- a vendor responds to a problem or question. These people get top marks from me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit, Good Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty darn good piece of machinery... It's made in China, but what isn't these days. Overall the item seems well-made and sturdy, but I haven't hooked it up yet... Note, this hose reel will be wall mounted and needs to be anchored into the wall studs. The unit is not wide enough to do that so I'll need some additional hardware to make the installation work, and last. But for now it appears it will be with us for a long time...
customer_reviews.author: Diana Brown/Stephen Brown

product_meta.title: Liberty Garden 703-1 Multi-Purpose Steel Garden Wall/Floor Mount Hose Reel, Tan
product_meta.description:
Color:TanLiberty Garden Products 703-1 Steel Multi-Purpose Wall and Floor Mounted Hose Reel is simple and functional. This Industrial grade reel easily secures to walls, lawn or turf. The included rubber boots are ideal for a non-skid floor mount. This reel holds up to 200-feet of 5/8- garden hose and has 5-feet of leader hose. Simply pull out the hose for use, rewind when done. Made of steel with a durable powder coat finish that resists rust. Comes fully assembled. Mounting hardware not included. Color: tan.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Hose pulls out for use-reels in for storage. The versatile 703 Hose Reel is a heavy-duty, solid wall mounted reel that also anchors to the lawn or turf or add the rubber boots for a nonskid floor mount. Made of tough 13 Gauge steel with industrial strength Powder Coated Finish, this is one unit that will suit a variety of your hose reel needs.
feature_bullets: Holds up to 200-feet of 5/8-inch garden hose (hose not included)
Industrial grade, heavy duty, solid wall mounted reel that anchors to lawn or turf, rubber boots are ideal for a non-skid floor mount
Made of tough 13 gauge steel with industrial strength powder coated finish that is weather resistant

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars806 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
